alert.note: Alert for Ventura (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued March 15 at 2:15AM PDT until March 15 at 6:43PM PDT by NWS Oxnard
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL 8 AM PDT THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Urban area and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of southwest California, including the following county, Ventura. * WHEN...Until 800 AM PDT. * IMPACTS...Flooding of Conejo Creek in Camarillo is imminent or occurring. Streams continue to rise due to excess runoff from earlier and ongoing rainfall. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 212 AM PDT, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated moderate to heavy rain across the warning area. Flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the warned area. Between 1.5 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 0.5 to 0.75 inches are possible in the warned area. Flooding is likely along the Conejo Creek, especially near Leisure Village and near the intersection of Adohr Lane and Ridge View Street. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Camarillo. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
